prompt: Under what conditions can a denied student be excused from attendance requirements and permitted to take an exam?
completion: A denied student can be exempted from attendance provisions and allowed to take an examination if they present an acceptable excuse to the College Council or the body delegated by it.

prompt: In what situations can a denied student be exempted from attendance provisions and allowed to sit for an examination?
completion: If a student is turned down, they may skip attendance and take an exam if they provide a valid reason to the College Council or its representatives.

prompt: Are there any circumstances where a denied student can be excused from attendance rules and allowed to take an exam?
completion: A student who is denied can be excused from attendance and allowed to take an exam if they present an acceptable excuse to the College Council or its delegates.

prompt: What is the minimum attendance required for a student to take an examination?
completion: The minimum attendance required for a student to take an examination is 50 percent of the lectures and laboratory sessions specified for the course.

prompt: What is the minimum attendance percentage that a student needs to fulfill to be eligible to take an exam?

prompt: How much attendance is necessary for a student to be qualified to sit for an examination?

prompt: What happens to a student's grade if they are absent for a final examination?
completion: If a student is absent for a final examination, they will be given a zero grade for that examination, and their grade in the course will be calculated on the basis of the class work score they obtained over the semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student is absent for a final exam, what effect will it have on their grade?
completion: A student who misses the final exam will receive a zero grade for it, and their overall course grade will be calculated based on the class work score they received throughout the semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Does a student's absence from a final exam have any impact on their grade?
completion: If a student is not present for the final examination, they will receive a grade of zero for that exam, and their grade for the course will be calculated based on the score they received for their classwork during the semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is it possible for a student to take a make-up examination if they have missed the final examination with a compelling excuse?
completion: Yes, it is possible for a student to take a make-up examination if they have missed the final examination with a compelling excuse.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student take a makeup exam if they missed the final exam with a valid reason?
completion: A student with a valid excuse for missing the final exam can take a makeup exam.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student has a legitimate excuse for missing the final exam, is there an option for them to take a makeup exam?
completion: If a student has a compelling reason for missing the final exam, they may take a makeup exam.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the process for a student to request a make-up examination?
completion: To request a make-up examination, the student must present their excuse to the College Dean and ask permission to take a make-up examination within the time period prior to the end of the following semester. The course instructor submits a report to the department chairperson, which will be discussed in the department and then in the College Councils. The dean subsequently will inform the student of the Council’s decision with regard to approval or rejection. If approved, the student will be informed of the date of the make-up examination.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How does a student request a makeup exam?
completion: To ask for a makeup exam, the student must provide their excuse to the College Dean and request permission to take the exam before the end of the following semester. The course instructor will submit a report to the department chairperson, and the department and College Councils will discuss it. The student will be informed of the Council's decision by the dean, and if approved, the date of the makeup exam will be announced.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the steps involved for a student to apply for a makeup exam?
completion: A student must submit their excuse to the College Dean to request a makeup exam before the end of the following semester. The department chairperson will receive a report from the course instructor, which will be discussed in the department and then in the College Councils. The dean will inform the student of the Council's decision, and if approved, the date of the makeup exam will be communicated.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What happens to a student's final course grade if they are allowed to take a make-up examination?
completion: If a student is allowed to take a make-up examination, their final course grade will be given after the make-up examination.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student is permitted to take a makeup exam, how will it impact their final course grade?
completion: The final course grade for a student who takes a makeup exam will be given after the exam.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Does a student's final course grade change if they are allowed to take a makeup exam?
completion: Once a student takes a makeup exam, their final course grade will be issued.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student withdraw from the University for a semester without failing their courses?
completion: Yes, a student can withdraw from the University for a semester without failing their courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is it possible for a student to take a semester off without failing their courses?
completion: It's possible for a student to take a leave of absence from the University for a semester without failing their courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student take a leave of absence without receiving failing grades for their courses?
completion: Students can temporarily withdraw from the University for a semester without failing their courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the deadline for a student to withdraw from the University for a semester?
completion: The deadline for a student to request a semester withdrawal from the University is five weeks before the final exams begin.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: When is the last date for a student to withdraw from the University for a semester?
completion: A student must request a withdrawal from the University for a semester at least five weeks before the commencement of final exams.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the cutoff date for a student to take a leave of absence for a semester?
completion: Five weeks prior to the final examinations, a student must submit a request to withdraw from the University for a semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Under what circumstances can the University Council extend the permitted deadline for withdrawal?
completion: Under exceptional circumstances, the University Council can prolong the deadline for requesting a semester withdrawal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the conditions under which the University Council can extend the deadline for withdrawal?
completion: The University Council has the power to extend the period in which a student can request a semester withdrawal in extraordinary circumstances.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is there a situation where the University Council can allow an extension of the deadline for withdrawing?
completion: In exceptional cases, the University Council may extend the deadline for requesting a semester withdrawal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What grade is assigned to a student who withdraws from the University for a semester with an acceptable excuse?
completion: If a student takes an authorized leave of absence from the University for a semester, they will be given a W grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the grade given to a student who takes a leave of absence from the University for a semester with an acceptable reason?
completion: A student who takes an approved leave of absence from the University for a semester will be assigned a W grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Does a student receive a specific grade if they withdraw from the University for a semester with a valid excuse?
completion: A W grade is awarded to a student who takes an authorized leave of absence from the University for a semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Who is responsible for reviewing applications for withdrawing from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: The Admission and Registration Deanship evaluates requests for withdrawal from taking a course(s) for a semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Which department is responsible for processing applications for withdrawal from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: Applications to withdraw from a course(s) for a semester are reviewed by the Admission and Registration Deanship.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Who is in charge of considering requests to withdraw from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: The Admission and Registration Deanship is responsible for considering applications for withdrawing from a course(s) for a semester.

prompt: Who has the final say on applications for withdrawal from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: The Rector of the University makes the final decision regarding requests for withdrawal.

prompt: Which authority makes the ultimate decision on applications for withdrawal from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: The Rector of the University has the ultimate authority to decide on applications for withdrawal.

prompt: Who makes the final determination regarding requests to withdraw from a course(s) for a semester?
completion: Applications for withdrawal are ultimately decided by the Rector of the University.

prompt: What happens to a student's academic record if they have earned any course grades before submitting an application to withdraw?
completion: Grades earned before submitting an application to withdraw will be recorded in the student's academic transcript.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How are grades affected if a student applies to withdraw after already earning course grades?
completion: The academic record of a student will retain any grades they earned before applying for withdrawal.

prompt: If a student has earned course grades prior to withdrawing, what happens to their academic record?
completion: If a student applies for withdrawal, any course grades they have already earned will still appear on their academic record.

prompt: If a student is approved for withdrawal from all courses during the stipulated period, what grade will they be given in the remaining courses?
completion: If a student's application for withdrawal from all courses is approved during the designated period, they will receive a W grade for the remaining courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the grade given to students in remaining courses if they withdraw from all courses during the approved period?
completion: Upon approval of a student's request to withdraw from all courses within the specified period, a W grade will be assigned for the remaining courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student withdraws from all courses during the stipulated period, what grade is assigned for remaining courses?
completion: A student who is granted permission to withdraw from all courses during the designated period will receive a W grade for any remaining courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How is the grade for remaining courses determined if a student is approved for withdrawal?
completion: The course instructor, in consultation with the department chairperson, will determine the grade for remaining courses based on the student's performance before withdrawal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What method is used to calculate the grade for remaining courses if a student is allowed to withdraw?
completion: The student's academic performance before withdrawal will be used by the course instructor and department chairperson to determine the grade for remaining courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student is granted permission to withdraw, how is the grade for remaining courses determined?
completion: Remaining course grades will be determined by the course instructor and department chairperson, taking into account the student's academic performance before withdrawing.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the two situations in which a student may be dismissed from the university according to Article 20?
completion: A student may be dismissed from the university if (a) they receive a maximum of three consecutive academic probations for having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, or (b) they fail to complete the graduation requirements within a maximum additional period equal to one-half of the period determined for their graduation in the original program period.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the grounds for dismissal from the university under Article 20?
completion: If a student receives three consecutive academic probations for having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, or fails to meet graduation requirements within the given time frame, the university may dismiss them.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 20, what circumstances can result in a student's dismissal from the university?
completion: The university may dismiss a student if they get three consecutive academic probations for a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, or fail to complete graduation requirements within a maximum additional period equal to one-half of their original program period.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How many academic probations can a student receive for having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, before being dismissed from the university?
completion: A student can receive a maximum of three academic probations for having a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, before being dismissed from the university.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the maximum number of academic probations a student can receive before being dismissed from the university for low cumulative GPA?
completion: The university allows a student to have a maximum of three academic probations for a cumulative GPA lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00, before facing dismissal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to the policy, how many times can a student be put on academic probation for a low cumulative GPA before being dismissed from the university?
completion: Before being dismissed from the university, a student can have up to three academic probations if their cumulative GPA is lower than 2.00 out of 5.00, or 1.00 out of 4.00.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student who receives three consecutive academic probations be granted a fourth chance to improve his/her cumulative GPA by studying the courses available? If yes, what body is responsible for making this decision?
completion: Yes, a student who receives three consecutive academic probations can be granted a fourth chance to improve their cumulative GPA by studying the courses available based on the recommendations of the College Council, and the University Council is responsible for making this decision.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is a student who receives three consecutive academic probations allowed to continue studying and improve their cumulative GPA? If so, who makes this decision?
completion: The College Council may recommend additional courses for a student who has received three consecutive academic probations to improve their cumulative GPA, and the University Council has the final say in granting this opportunity.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Under what circumstances can a student who has received three consecutive academic probations improve their cumulative GPA by studying the courses available, and who is responsible for approving this decision?
completion: If a student gets three consecutive academic probations, they can study recommended courses to improve their cumulative GPA, and the University Council has the authority to approve this opportunity.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the maximum additional period given to a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements in the original program period before being dismissed from the university?
completion: The maximum additional period given to a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements in the original program period is equal to one-half of the period determined for their graduation.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How long is the maximum additional period given to a student who fails to complete graduation requirements within the original program period before being dismissed from the university?
completion: If a student fails to complete graduation requirements within the original program period, the maximum additional time given to them is half of the determined period for graduation.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to the policy, what is the maximum duration of the additional period given to students who fail to complete graduation requirements within the original program period before facing dismissal from the university?
completion: The university allows a maximum additional period equal to half the determined period for graduation to a student who cannot complete graduation requirements within the original program period.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements within the maximum additional period be given an additional period of a maximum duration equal to that specified for graduation? Who is responsible for making this decision?
completion: The University Council may make an exception and give a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements within the maximum additional period an additional period of a maximum duration equal to that specified for graduation.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements within the maximum additional period given another chance to complete the program? If so, who approves this decision?
completion: If a student fails to complete graduation requirements within the maximum additional period, the University Council may grant an additional period of a maximum duration equal to that specified for graduation.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to the policy, can a student who fails to complete the graduation requirements within the maximum additional period be given another period equal to that specified for graduation, and who is responsible for making this decision?
completion: The University Council has the authority to allow an additional period of maximum duration to a student who fails to complete graduation requirements within the maximum additional period.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How long is the additional period given to students who fall under situation (a) or (b) in Article 20 to complete their studies?
completion: The additional period given to students who fall under situation (a) or (b) in Article 20 to complete their studies is two semesters.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the duration of the additional period given to students under situation (a) or (b) in Article 20 to complete their studies?
completion: Students who fall under situation (a) or (b) in Article 20 are allowed an additional period of two semesters to complete their studies.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to the policy, how long is the additional period given to students who fall under situation (a) or (b) in Article 20 to complete their studies?
completion: Under Article 20, students who meet the criteria of situation (a) or (b) are granted an extension of two semesters to finish their studies.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is required of a dismissed student before leaving the university?
completion: A dismissed student is required to obtain a clearance form from the Admission and Registration Deanship and Accounting, and have it signed by the departments specified in Article 19 before leaving the university.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the procedures that a dismissed student must follow before leaving the university?
completion: Prior to leaving the university, a dismissed student must acquire a clearance form from the Admission and Registration Deanship and Accounting, and have it signed by the departments listed in Article 19.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to the policy, what are the requirements for a dismissed student before leaving the university?
completion: To exit the university, a student who has been dismissed must obtain a clearance form from the Admission and Registration Deanship and Accounting, and get it signed by the departments identified in Article 19.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the minimum percentage of class work score required for the final course grade, as stated in Article 22?
completion: According to Article 22, at least 30 percent of the final course grade must be based on class work score.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How much weight should be given to class work in determining the final course grade according to Article 22?
completion: Class work score must account for a minimum of 30 percent of the final course grade, as per Article 22.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 22, what is the minimum percentage of the final grade that should come from class work score?
completion: The final course grade must be comprised of at least 30 percent of class work score, in accordance with Article 22.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the methods for evaluating class work score, as stated in Article 23?
completion: According to Article 23, the class work score can be evaluated either through one written exam plus oral and practical exams, research papers, or other class activities, or at least two written exams.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In accordance with Article 23, how is the class work score assessed?
completion: Article 23 allows for evaluation of class work score either through a combination of written, oral, practical exams, research papers, or other class activities, or by conducting at least two written exams.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 23, what are the ways in which the class work score can be evaluated?
completion: As per Article 23, evaluation of class work score can either be through at least one written exam plus oral and practical exams, research papers, or other class activities, or at least two written exams.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Is it possible to have practical or oral tests included in the final examination of a course, and who is responsible for deciding the weight of these tests in the final score, as stated in Article 24?
completion: According to Article 24, the final examination of any course can include practical or oral tests if approved by the College Council, and the proportion of the final score assigned to these tests can be specified.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 24, can the final exam of a course include practical or oral tests, and who determines the percentage of the final score assigned to these tests?
completion: Article 24 permits inclusion of practical or oral tests in the final examination of any course if sanctioned by the College Council, and the portion of the final score that can be attributed to these tests can be determined.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Who is responsible for specifying the proportion of the final score assigned to practical or oral tests in the final examination of any course, and is it permissible to include these tests, as stated in Article 24?
completion: As per Article 24, practical or oral tests can be included in the final examination of any course if allowed by the College Council, and the proportion of the final score assigned to these tests can be specified.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student complete the requirements of a course in the following semester, and what will be recorded in the student's academic record, as stated in Article 25?
completion: According to Article 25, a student may be allowed to complete the requirements of any course in the following semester, subject to recommendation by the course instructor and the department council, and an IC grade will be recorded in the student's academic record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 25, is it possible for a student to fulfill the requirements of a course in the following semester, and what will be recorded in the student's academic record?
completion: If recommended by the course instructor and the department council, a student can complete the requirements of any course in the next semester, and an IC grade will be recorded in their academic record, as per Article 25.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In the case where a student completes a course's requirements in a following semester, what will be recorded in the student's academic record, according to Article 25?
completion: Article 25 states that a student may be granted permission to complete any course requirements in the following semester, provided that it is recommended by the course instructor and department council, and an IC grade will be added to their academic record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Will a student's grade in a course be included in the calculation of their semester or cumulative GPA until they receive a final grade, as stated in Article 25?
completion: According to Article 25, the student's grade in the course will not be factored into the calculation of the semester or cumulative GPA until they have completed the course requirements and received a grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Does a student's grade in a course count towards their semester or cumulative GPA until they receive a final grade, as stated in Article 25?
completion: The student's grade in the course will not be included in the calculation of their semester or cumulative GPA until they have met the course requirements and received a grade, as per Article 25.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: According to Article 25, is a student's GPA affected by a course's grade if the student has not yet received a final grade for the course?
completion: As per Article 25, the student's grade in the course will not be taken into account when calculating their semester or cumulative GPA until they have fulfilled the course requirements and obtained a grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Under what circumstances may a student be permitted to complete course requirements during the following semester?
completion: A student may be granted permission to complete course requirements during the following semester if exceptional circumstances beyond their control exist, pending approval from the department offering the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the situations in which a student can finish course requirements in the next semester?
completion: In certain circumstances, a student can be given permission to finish course requirements during the next semester, with approval from the department offering the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In what scenarios is it possible for a student to complete course requirements in a following semester?
completion: If a student is facing uncontrollable circumstances, they may be permitted to complete course requirements during the next semester, pending approval from the relevant department.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is an IC grade, and when is it assigned to a student?
completion: An IC grade is given to a student who is allowed to complete course requirements during the following semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: When is a student given an IC grade, and what does it mean?
completion: When a student is allowed to finish course requirements during the next semester, they will receive an IC grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the circumstances in which an IC grade is assigned to a student, and what does it signify?
completion: Students who are permitted to complete course requirements during the following semester are assigned an IC grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the procedure for changing an IC grade to a final grade earned by the student?
completion: Upon completion of the course requirements within the specified period, the instructor will change the IC grade to the earned grade, within one semester after the semester in which the IC grade was assigned. The Admission and Registration Deanship must be notified of the grade change by the instructor.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How can a student change an IC grade to the final grade that they earned?
completion: The instructor will change the IC grade to the earned grade once the student completes the course requirements within the given period. The Admission and Registration Deanship must be notified of this change by the instructor within one semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the steps involved in converting an IC grade to the grade a student actually earned?
completion: Within a given period, if a student completes the course requirements, the instructor must change the IC grade to the earned grade and inform the Admission and Registration Deanship within one semester.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Can a student extend the period required to complete a course, and under what circumstances?
completion: Co-operative program students may extend the time required to complete a course by one regular semester, with the department chairperson's approval. Students with an IC grade prior to joining the co-operative program may have the opportunity to complete incomplete courses within one regular semester after finishing the program.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In what situations can a student request an extension to complete a course, if at all?
completion: The department chairperson may approve a one-semester extension for co-operative program students to complete a course. Students with an IC grade before joining the co-operative program may complete incomplete courses within one regular semester after completing the program.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What circumstances must exist for a student to be allowed to extend the time required to complete a course?
completion: Students enrolled in the co-operative program can receive approval from the department chairperson to extend the time required to finish a course by one regular semester. Additionally, students with an IC grade before joining the co-operative program may complete incomplete courses within one regular semester following the program's completion.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What happens if a student does not complete course requirements within the specified period?
completion: If the student does not finish the course requirements within the specified period, the IC status will be changed to an F grade, which will be included in the calculation of the semester and cumulative GPAs.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the consequences if a student fails to complete course requirements within the specified period?
completion: If the student is unable to complete the course requirements within the given period, the IC status will be changed to an F grade, which will be included in the calculation of the semester and cumulative GPAs.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student doesn't complete the course requirements within the specified period, what happens next?
completion: Failure to complete the course requirements within the specified period will result in the IC status being changed to an F grade, which will be factored into the calculation of the semester and cumulative GPAs.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How does having an IC grade affect a student's general grade and distinction status?
completion: An IC grade leads to the student's general grade for that semester being suspended, including their distinction status.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In what ways does obtaining an IC grade influence a student's overall grade and standing in terms of honors?
completion: The suspension of the student's general grade during that semester, including their distinction status, is a result of an IC grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What impact does having an IC grade have on a student's distinction status and overall grade?
completion: An IC grade causes the suspension of the student's general grade for that semester, as well as their distinction status.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Are there any restrictions on a student's registration for a course if he/she has an IC grade in its prerequisite course?
completion: Students who have earned an IC grade in the prerequisite course are not allowed to register for the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student has an IC grade in a prerequisite course, are there any limitations on their registration for the subsequent course?
completion: If a student has an IC grade in the prerequisite course, they cannot enroll in the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What restrictions, if any, exist on a student's ability to register for a course if they have an IC grade in the prerequisite course?
completion: Students with an IC grade in the prerequisite course are prohibited from registering for the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Which courses may be excluded from part or all of the rules in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: Courses of a practical or field work nature, as well as those that involve symposia and/or research, may not be subject to all or part of the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the courses exempt from the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: Courses that require field work or research, or involve symposia, may not follow all or some of the regulations outlined in Articles 22, 23, and 24.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Which courses can be excluded from some or all of the provisions in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: Regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24 may be waived for courses that involve practical or field work or symposia, as well as research courses.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Who makes the decision to exclude courses from the rules in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: The College Council and the department council responsible for teaching the course decide which courses are exempt from the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Who has the authority to decide which courses are exempt from the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: The decision to exclude certain courses from following the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24 is made jointly by the College Council and the department council that teaches the course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: By whom is the decision made to exclude certain courses from the provisions in Articles 22, 23, and 24?
completion: Both the College Council and the department council in charge of teaching the course determine which courses are not subject to the regulations in Articles 22, 23, and 24.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the criteria for calculating the final grades of students in each course?
completion: The final grade calculation for each course is based on the percentage of the student's score and its corresponding grade significance, as described in Article 28.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What factors are used to determine students' final grades in each course?
completion: Article 28 sets out the criteria for determining students' final grades, which include the percentage of their score and its corresponding grade significance.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What standards are employed in computing the final grades of students in every course?
completion: The calculation of students' final grades in each course is based on the percentage of their score and its corresponding grade significance, according to Article 28.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How many levels are students' scores classified into?
completion: Based on their score percentage, students are classified into nine levels, as outlined in Article 28.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: In how many levels are students' grades categorized?
completion: Students are classified into nine levels based on their score percentage, as specified in Article 28.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Into how many tiers are students' scores divided?
completion: Article 28 explains that students are divided into nine levels based on their score percentage.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What happens if a student attends a course as an auditor?
completion: Regardless of their performance, students who audit a course will receive an AU grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the consequence of attending a course as an auditor?
completion: Students who audit a course will be assigned an AU grade, regardless of their performance.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What occurs if a student takes a course as an auditor?
completion: The grade AU is assigned to students who audit a course, regardless of their performance.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the effect of the grade NP or F on a student's record?
completion: A student's record is negatively impacted by an NP or F grade, which indicates failure to pass a course offered on a pass/fail basis, such as thesis and summer training programs.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: How does receiving a grade of NP or F impact a student's academic record?
completion: An NP or F grade has a negative effect on a student's academic record, as it signifies failure to pass a course offered on a pass/fail basis, like thesis or summer training programs.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the impact on a student's academic transcript if they receive an NP or F grade?
completion: Grades of NP or F have an adverse effect on a student's record, as they represent a failure to pass a course offered on a pass/fail basis, such as a thesis or summer training program.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the grade WP, and when is it assigned to a student?
completion: A student who officially withdraws from all courses after the deadline may receive a WP grade, provided their performance was satisfactory and their unexcused absences did not exceed 20 percent of lectures and laboratory sessions before their withdrawal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: When is the grade WP given to a student, and what does it signify?
completion: If a student withdraws from all courses after the deadline, they may receive a WP grade if their performance was satisfactory and their unexcused absences did not exceed 20 percent of lectures and laboratory sessions before their withdrawal.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What does the grade WP mean, and under what circumstances is it assigned to a student?
completion: Students who withdraw from all courses after the deadline and meet certain criteria may receive a WP grade, indicating that their performance was satisfactory.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What is the grade WF, and when is it assigned to a student?
completion: A student who withdraws from all courses after the deadline and their performance was unsatisfactory may receive a WF grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: When is the grade WF awarded to a student, and what does it represent?
completion: If a student withdraws from all courses after the deadline and their performance was unsatisfactory, they may receive a WF grade.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What does the grade WF signify, and in what situations is it assigned to a student?
completion: Students who withdraw from all courses after the deadline and fail to meet certain criteria may receive a WF grade, signifying their unsatisfactory performance.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What happens if a student is absent for more than one-third of the classes in a course?
completion: If a student is absent for more than one-third of the classes in a course, the course will be eliminated from their record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: If a student misses over one-third of the classes in a course, what are the repercussions?
completion: When a student misses over a third of the classes in a course, the course will be removed from their record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What are the consequences if a student is absent from more than one-third of the classes in a course?
completion: Any course that a student has missed over one-third of the classes will be deleted from their academic record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: When is the grade IP assigned to a student, and what happens if they fail to complete the course within the specified time?
completion: The grade IP is assigned to a student when a course of a research nature requires more than one semester to complete. If the student fails to complete the course within the specified time, the department council that offers the course may approve assigning an IC grade to the student’s record for this course.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: Under what circumstances is the grade IP assigned to a student, and what does it signify?
completion: Students who require more than one semester to finish a research-based course will be given a grade of IP. If the student doesn't complete the course within the given time, the department council offering the course may decide to assign an IC grade to their record.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs

prompt: What does the grade IP indicate, and what occurs if a student is unable to complete the course within the stipulated timeframe?
completion: A grade of IP is given to students enrolled in a research-based course that takes more than one semester to complete. The department council that provides the course may permit an IC grade to be given to the student's record if they fail to finish the course within the specified time.
pageType: Admiision/ Rules& regulations and its sub tabs
